data.title: Kadokawa unveils Crunchyroll’s ‘Bungo Stray Dogs’ season four key image and cast additions
data.meta_description: Kadokawa unveils Crunchyroll’s ‘Bungo Stray Dogs’ season four key image and cast additions - Animation
data.text:
Kadokawa has announced two new cast members and shared a new key image for Bungo Stray Dogs season four, Anime News Network first reported. Joining the series are Yuuki Kaji (Attack on Titan, JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure) voicing Saigiku Jōno, and Yōhei Azakami (Mobile Suit Gundam: The Witch from Mercury) voicing Tecchō Suehiro.

Also new to this season are Akio Ohtsuka as Genichirō Fukuchi; Makoto Koichi as Teruko Ōkura; Takehito Koyasu as Nikolai G; and Takeshi Kusao as Mushitarō Oguri. They join main cast members Yūto Uemura (Atsushi Nakajima); Mamoru Miyano (Osamu Dazai); Sumire Morohoshi (Kyōka Izumi); Kensho Ono (Ryūnosuke Akutagawa); and Kishō Taniyama (Chūya Nakahara).

Crunchyroll will stream season four in January 2023 as it airs in Japan.

In the series, Atsushi Nakajima meets Dazai Osamu, a member of a special detective agency where they have supernatural powers and deal with cases too dangerous for the police or military. Atsushi, actually a weretiger himself, becomes enmeshed with the agency, and other supernatural beings.

Bungo Stray Dogs is based on the Kafka Asagiri and Sango Harukawa manga of the same name. Director Takuya Igarashi returns for the new season along with series script supervisor and writer Yoji Enokido; character designer and chief animation director Nobuhiro Arai. BONES animation studio once again produces.
